controls.name: Policy Objectives, Scope, and Covered Instruments
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Part 703 requires a written investment policy consistent with the Act and other laws, addressing safety and soundness, including credit, liquidity, interest rate, and concentration risks.([GovRegs](https://www.govregs.com/regulations/expand/title12_chapterVII_part703_subpartA_section703.3?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Store a single canonical Investment Policy record with effective and next-review dates.
  * Tag all portfolio positions that fall under this Policy (investments, repos, deposits, and other non-loan asset placements).
triggers: Board approves new or revised Investment Policy (governance.investment_policy_approved)
Compliance updates policy metadata in system (compliance.policy_record_updated)
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Max 12 months between board approvals; system warns 60 and 30 days before next\_review.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * If policy lapses (no approval by next\_review), investments remain governed by prior policy but system flags as non-compliant until board action. (Assumption—needs confirmation: whether CU will impose an internal trading freeze if policy expires.)
controls.access_control:
**
  * Edit: Compliance, CIO, and limited designees.
  * View: Board, ALCO, internal audit, examiners (read-only export).
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Metric: “Days until Investment Policy review.”
  * Alert when `days_until_review <= 60` and escalated at `<= 30`.
controls.purpose: Anchor safety, liquidity, yield, and compliance objectives; define what assets are governed by this Policy.

controls.name: Governance, Board Oversight, and Delegations
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Board must establish, approve, and at least annually review the investment policy, and ensure policies are within applicable law and regulations.([GovInfo](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/CFR-2018-title12-vol7/pdf/CFR-2018-title12-vol7-part703.pdf?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Maintain authority matrix for investment decision-making and limits by role.
  * Link each trade and exception to an authorized approver.
triggers: CEO or Board delegates investment authority (governance.authority_delegated)
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Annual Board review of policy and authority matrix (≤ 12 months apart).
  * Exceptions documented and approved **before** settlement.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Emergent trade needed when approver unavailable → escalation to next senior officer in matrix; auto-email to Board Chair within 1 business day for ratification. (Assumption—needs confirmation: appetite for post-facto ratification in emergencies.)
controls.access_control:
**
  * Edit authorities: Board/CEO (via designated admin).
  * Read-only: Investment staff, risk, internal audit.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Count of trades executed by each role vs. assigned limits.
  * Alerts when trade or exposure exceeds configured role limit.
controls.purpose: Define board responsibilities, delegations, and review cadence.

controls.name: Permissible Investments and Prohibited Activities
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Part 703 requires policies to define permissible investments and address prohibited activities/investments.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/part-703/subpart-A?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Enforce an **allow-list** of instrument types and structures mapped to Part 703 categories (e.g., U.S. Treasuries, agency securities, municipal securities, corporate bonds, deposits, CUSO investments, repos, etc.).
  * Block trade booking for instruments or activities tagged as prohibited or not permitted for the CU.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Permissible list review at least annually and whenever Part 703 changes materially.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Grandfathered or pilot investments handled via explicit tag `(instrument.status = 'grandfathered' / 'pilot')` with board approval reference and sunset date.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Edit permissible list: CIO, Compliance.
  * Booking rights: Approved traders only.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Number of blocked trades for policy reasons.
  * Exposure by Part 703 category for Board reporting.
controls.purpose: Enumerate allowed instruments and explicitly bar prohibited activities.

controls.name: Interest Rate Risk (IRR) & ALM Integration
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Part 703 and related guidance require investment policies to address interest rate risk; ALM policies may cover IRR across the balance sheet.([Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2003/06/03/03-13660/investment-and-deposit-activities-and-regulatory-flexibility-program?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Capture effective duration, convexity, and cash-flow vectors for each security.
  * Feed ALM models with current and stressed cash flows for IRR measurement.
triggers: New security booked requiring IRR parameters (investment.new_security_booked)
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * At least quarterly ALM/IRR simulations; more frequent if risk thresholds are breached.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Complex structured securities where vendor models differ → store both vendor and internal scenarios; flag discrepancies above defined threshold.
controls.access_control:
**
  * ALM parameters editable only by Risk/ALCO analyst roles.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Contribution of investments to EVE and NII sensitivity vs. risk limits.
  * Breach alerts tied into [IP-12](investment.md#ip-12-ongoing-monitoring-reporting-and-stress-testing).
primary_rules: Part 703 preamble & guidance requiring IRR policy for investments
controls.purpose: Integrate investments with IRR and ALM framework.

controls.name: Credit Risk Standards and Downgrade Management
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.6 requires documented credit analysis before purchase and at least annually thereafter for non-government/fully insured investments.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.6?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Require a completed credit file and approval before booking eligible non-governmental investments.
  * Track annual re-analysis due dates and rating/deterioration triggers with automated tasks.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Pre-purchase credit analysis must be complete before trade.
  * Annual review completed by `credit.next_review_due`.
  * Downgrade from internal “investment grade” threshold: review within 5 business days; Board notified for material positions.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Sudden credit event (e.g., default/credit watch) without updated financials → immediate placement on internal watch list; interim qualitative memo before full refresh.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Credit files editable by Credit/Risk only; read-only to traders.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Count and total exposure of issuers on watch list.
  * SLA adherence for annual reviews.
controls.purpose: Define minimum credit standards, analysis, monitoring, and downgrade responses.

controls.name: Liquidity and Marketability Limits
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Investments must support liquidity and CFP requirements under §741.12; policy must address liquidity risk.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/741.12?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Tag each investment with liquidity classification (e.g., HQLA-like, marketable, thinly traded, illiquid).
  * Calculate on-demand and 30-day stress liquidity capacity from investments.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * At least monthly liquidity coverage report; more frequent in stress.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Investments with no observable market price → conservative liquidity classification and haircut; escalation to ALCO. (Assumption—needs confirmation: whether CU will set explicit internal minimum share of “readily marketable” securities.)
controls.access_control:
**
  * Liquidity parameters editable by Treasury/Risk; read-only otherwise.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Breach of minimum liquid-asset buffer triggers [IP-17](investment.md#ip-17-contingency-planning-and-liquidity-stress-events).
controls.purpose: Ensure investments support daily and stressed liquidity needs.

controls.name: Concentration and Counterparty Limits
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Investment policy must explain how concentration risk will be managed; Part 703 and NCUA guidance stress issuer, sector, and product concentration limits.([Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2003/06/03/03-13660/investment-and-deposit-activities-and-regulatory-flexibility-program?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Maintain parameterized limits by issuer, sector, rating, product type, and counterparty.
  * Enforce soft (warning) and hard (blocking) limits at trade entry.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * At least annual review of concentration limits; earlier if portfolio profile changes materially.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Temporary breach due to balance-sheet shrinkage rather than new purchases → flagged but permitted with documented remediation plan.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Limits editable by Risk with CIO and Board-approved parameters.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Number of limit exceptions granted; trend over time.
  * Top 10 exposures vs. capital.
primary_rules: Part 703 policy requirement to address concentration risk
controls.purpose: Limit exposures by issuer, sector, instrument, and counterparty.

controls.name: Approved Brokers, Dealers, and Safekeepers
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Part 703 requires due diligence and annual review of broker-dealers and safekeepers; safekeepers must be regulated and monitored under written custodial agreements.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.8?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Maintain an approved list of broker-dealers and safekeepers with due-diligence fields and review dates.
  * Block trades with unapproved intermediaries; require safekeeper linkage for each position.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Annual minimum due-diligence review per broker-dealer and safekeeper.
  * Monthly reconciliation of safekeeping statements per §703.9(c).([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.9?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Emergency trade required with non-approved dealer → flagged exception requiring CIO and Compliance approval plus prompt Board notification.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Edits: Compliance / Risk; read-only to trading, Finance, ALCO.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Intermediaries with overdue reviews.
  * Volume and P\&L by broker-dealer.
controls.purpose: Approve and monitor intermediaries and safekeeping arrangements.

controls.name: Repurchase and Reverse Repurchase Agreements
controls.why_reg_cite: ** NCUA policies on repos require safe-and-sound collateral practices and maturity match limits; borrowing repurchase maturity mismatch generally limited (e.g., 30 days) without expanded authority.([NCUA](https://ncua.gov/files/publications/irps/IRPS1985-02.pdf?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Represent each repo/reverse repo transaction with explicit fields for collateral, haircut, counterparties, and maturity mismatch.
  * Prevent booking repos that violate internal or regulatory mismatch and collateral rules.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Daily mark-to-market of collateral in stress or volatile markets; at least weekly otherwise (Assumption—needs confirmation: specific revaluation cadence).
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Collateral value shortfall vs. haircut → auto-alert and required margin call within defined timeframe (e.g., 1 business day).
controls.access_control:
**
  * Repo booking rights limited to Treasurer and designated staff.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Total repo exposure vs. capital.
  * Count of margin calls and any collateral shortfalls.
controls.purpose: Govern collateral, haircuts, maturity matching, and counterparties for repos.

controls.name: Valuation, Accounting, and Fair Value
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.4 requires GAAP-compliant recordkeeping; §703.11 requires at least monthly fair value determination, with independent assessment of pricing sources.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.4?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Capture book value, amortized cost, and fair value for each security.
  * Store pricing source and date; support OTTI analysis.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Monthly fair value update for all securities; annual external/supervisory committee assessment of pricing reliability.([GovInfo](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/CFR-2014-title12-vol7/pdf/CFR-2014-title12-vol7-sec703-11.pdf?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * No reliable quote available → use substantially similar security, document methodology, and apply conservative price.([GovInfo](https://www.govinfo.gov/link/cfr/12/703?link-type=pdf\&sectionnum=12\&year=mostrecent\&utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.access_control:
**
  * Pricing overrides restricted to CFO/Controller with dual-approval workflow.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Percentage of positions using non-primary pricing sources.
  * Unrealized loss as % of capital by product type.
controls.purpose: Set rules for GAAP compliance, fair value measurement, and OTTI assessment.

controls.name: Pre-Purchase Due Diligence and Exceptions
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.6 mandates documented credit analysis before purchase (with limited exceptions), and NCUA guidance requires independent risk assessment beyond ratings.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.6?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Enforce a pre-trade checklist and approval workflow before any new investment is booked (other than U.S. government/fully insured instruments).
  * Require linkage of each trade ticket to a credit memo and valuation support.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Pre-purchase checklist completed and approved before trade date.
  * Exceptions (where permitted) documented before settlement.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Same issuer/add-on purchases within pre-defined limits may allow streamlined checklist referencing prior memo, but still require documented tie-back. (Assumption—needs confirmation: specific thresholds for streamlined process.)
controls.access_control:
**
  * Credit memo editing restricted to Credit/Risk; traders read-only.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Ratio of trades with exceptions to total trades.
  * Time to complete pre-purchase reviews.
controls.purpose: Define documentation, approvals, and exception handling before purchase.

controls.name: Ongoing Monitoring, Reporting, and Stress Testing
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.12 and related sections require at least monthly written reports on investments and monitoring of risk; liquidity rule requires CFP and stress planning.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.11?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Generate recurring reports on portfolio composition, duration, liquidity, unrealized gains/losses, limit adherence, and risk metrics.
  * Implement stress scenarios (rate shocks, spread widening, liquidity stress).
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Monthly management report; at least quarterly presentation to Board.
  * Stress tests at least annually and more frequently when risk metrics approach limits.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Data gaps or vendor outages → contingency reporting with clearly marked estimates and follow-up corrections.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Report definitions controlled by Risk/Finance; access for Board and examiners via secure portal or PDF.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * On-time completion of required reports.
  * Number of open remediation items from stress tests.
controls.purpose: Require ongoing performance, risk, and compliance reporting to ALCO and Board.

controls.name: Performance Measurement and Benchmarks
controls.why_reg_cite: ** While not prescribing specific benchmarks, NCUA expects investment activities to be consistent with safe and sound practices and risk tolerance; performance must be evaluated in that context.([Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2003/06/03/03-13660/investment-and-deposit-activities-and-regulatory-flexibility-program?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Attribute portfolio total return and income relative to chosen benchmarks by segment (e.g., Treasuries vs. agencies vs. municipals).
  * Ensure performance targets do not create incentives to breach risk limits.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Quarterly Board-level performance review as part of investment reporting.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Benchmark index changes → require ALCO approval and documented rationale.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Performance configuration editable by CIO and Risk.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Tracking error and risk-adjusted return vs. policy; flags if performance is achieved via higher-than-approved risk.
controls.purpose: Align portfolio performance assessment with risk and policy limits.

controls.name: Trade Execution, Controls, and Segregation of Duties
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.4 requires policies to address internal controls and segregation of duties in investment activities.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.4?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Segregate responsibilities among trade initiation, approval, confirmation, settlement, and accounting.
  * Enforce dual-control for trade entry and post-trade reconciliation.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Trade confirmation and reconciliation within T+1 (Assumption—needs confirmation: targeted T+1 vs. T+2 SLA).
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Same person attempts to both enter and approve trade → system blocks and logs violation attempt.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Clear role definitions ensuring no single individual can control an entire transaction lifecycle.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Number of reconciliation breaks and age distribution.
  * Attempts at violating segregation-of-duties rules.
primary_rules: [12 CFR §703.4(b)](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.4) (internal controls and segregation of duties).([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.4?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.purpose: Ensure safe trade processing, confirmations, and reconciliations.

controls.name: Recordkeeping and Documentation Retention
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.4 sets recordkeeping and documentation requirements for investments and related activities.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/703.4?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Store and index all required documents: trade tickets, confirmations, credit memos, research, approvals, safekeeping statements, and reports.
  * Support retention schedules consistent with regulatory and internal requirements.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Documents attached to trades within 2 business days of event.
  * Retention periods at least equal to regulatory minimums; specifics to be set in Records Management Policy (cross-reference).
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Missing or damaged records → flag, attempt reconstruction, and document limitation for audit/examiners.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Role-based read/write; sensitive documents restricted to need-to-know.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Missing required documents by trade/position.
  * Imminent retention expiry requiring legal hold assessment.
controls.purpose: Define minimum records, retention periods, and accessibility.

controls.name: Training, Competency, and Conflicts of Interest
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Part 703 requires management competence; conflicts of interest in investment activities are explicitly prohibited under §703.17.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/part-703/subpart-A?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Track training completion for staff and board involved in investment oversight.
  * Maintain conflict-of-interest disclosures for key personnel and vendors.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Initial training before granting system access to execute or approve investments.
  * Annual refresher and COI certification for all covered persons.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Non-completion of training or COI certification → auto-suspension of investment system access until resolved.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Training records visible to HR, Compliance, and Internal Audit; summarized to Board.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Training completion rates.
  * COI issues logged and resolved.
controls.purpose: Set minimum training standards and manage conflicts.

controls.name: Contingency Planning and Liquidity Stress Events
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §741.12 requires a written CFP and planning for liquidity stress; investment portfolio is a core contingent liquidity source.([Legal Information Institute](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/741.12?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Maintain predefined liquidity stress scenarios (e.g., deposit run, market stress, combined).
  * Map investment liquidation hierarchy and playbooks tied into the CFP.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * At least annual CFP test; more frequent for larger/complex CUs.
  * Upon actual stress declaration, initial execution plan documented within 1 business day.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Market dislocation where planned sales not feasible at modeled haircuts → require revised plan and Board communication.
controls.access_control:
**
  * CFP configuration controlled by Treasury/Risk; viewing access for Board and examiners.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * Liquidity coverage ratios under base and stress vs. policy minimums.
  * Time to execute simulated CFP actions.
controls.purpose: Specify stress tests and playbooks for adverse markets.

controls.name: Policy Review, Amendments, and Version Control
controls.why_reg_cite: ** §703.3 requires the Board to review the investment policy at least annually; §741.3 ties investment policies to insurability criteria.([GovInfo](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/CFR-2018-title12-vol7/pdf/CFR-2018-title12-vol7-part703.pdf?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
controls.system_behavior:
**
  * Maintain full version history, redlines, and approval metadata for the Investment Policy.
  * Drive review tasks and track completion.
controls.timers_slas:
**
  * Review not less than annually; earlier if regulatory changes materially affect Part 703 or related rules.
controls.edge_cases:
**
  * Emergency interim updates (e.g., new prohibited instrument) requiring prompt Board ratification at next meeting.
controls.access_control:
**
  * Edit rights limited to Compliance/CIO; Board approves via governance workflow.
controls.alerts_metrics:
**
  * “Days since last Board approval.”
  * Count of outstanding follow-up items from prior reviews.
controls.purpose: Maintain compliant annual review and change control.

controls.name: Governance & Roles
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Board must approve/oversee continuity plans; management implements and reports. [12 CFR §701.4](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-701/section-701.4).
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain a living BCP/DR plan with clear owners; auto-collect training/tests; generate Board reports at least annually.
controls.timers_slas: ** Review **≥ annually**; IMT roster verified **quarterly**.
controls.edge_cases: ** CEO unavailable → pre-delegated acting IC (Incident Commander).
controls.access_control: ** Only BCM/Compliance may modify plan; Board read-only packet.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Past-due reviews; IMT coverage %; training completion %.
controls.purpose: Define Board→Management accountability and IMT roles.

controls.name: Risk Assessment (Hazards by Region)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Records and operations must be protectable against catastrophic events; identify risks by geography. [12 CFR Part 749](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-749).
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain threat register (wildfire/smoke—CA; earthquake—CA; tornado—TX; flood; grid outage; cyber; pandemic).
controls.timers_slas: ** Refresh **annually** or after major change.
controls.edge_cases: ** Multi-region concurrent events → separate ICs with unified command.
controls.access_control: ** BCM owns; contributors Ops/IT/HR.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % hazards with assigned mitigations; open CAP items.
controls.purpose: Identify/score scenarios (e.g., CA wildfire, TX tornado).

controls.name: Business Impact Analysis (BIA)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Identify **vital records** and functions to set RTO/RPO and recovery order. [12 CFR Part 749](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-749).
controls.system_behavior: ** Catalog services and rank by member impact/regulatory dependency.
controls.timers_slas: ** Update **annually**; certify quarterly for changes.
controls.edge_cases: ** Conflicts → COO arbitrates using decision priorities.
controls.access_control: ** Product owners provide data; BCM curates; Board views.
controls.alerts_metrics:
** % services with current BIA; % with tested runbooks.

> **Illustrative BIA Ranking (Assumption—needs confirmation):**
>
> * Member Authentication/Account Access
> * Card Processing
> * Core Banking/ACH/Wires
> * Payments & Deposits
> * Lending Origination/Servicing
> * Contact Center
> * Reporting/Reg Filings

controls.name: Training, Testing & Exercises
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Programs must be trained, tested, and validated; include incident response practices. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** Annual exercise plan (orientation, tabletop, functional); track completion; feed gaps to CAP.
controls.timers_slas: ** ≥1 enterprise exercise/year; report to Board ≤30 days after.
controls.edge_cases: ** Real incident substitutes for test if PIR completed.
controls.access_control: ** BCM controls plan; managers enforce attendance.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Training completion %; time-to-CAP close.
controls.purpose: Train staff; validate plans; Board reporting.

controls.name: Monitoring, Detection & Severity
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Safeguards require monitoring and prompt incident identification/response. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** Central on-call with severity matrix (SEV-1 to SEV-4); weather/cyber/vendor monitors; paging.
controls.timers_slas: ** IC assigned ≤5m for SEV-1; initial comms ≤15m.
controls.edge_cases: ** Conflicting alerts → highest impact drives SEV.
controls.access_control: ** SRE/SOC triage; BCM oversight.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** MTTA/MTTR; false positive rate.
controls.purpose: Detect incidents; classify severity; assign commander.

controls.name: Incident Declaration & Initial Actions
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Structured incident response is required to protect member information and services. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** “First hour” checklist: safety, stabilize, scope, assign roles, notify, set cadence.
controls.timers_slas: ** Sitrep v1 ≤30m; cadence 30–60m until stabilized.
controls.edge_cases: ** Multi-tenant vendor incident → join vendor bridge; retain independence on comms.
controls.access_control: ** IC leads; deputies comms/ops/logs.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % incidents with complete first-hour checklist.

controls.name: Data Backup & Restore; RTO/RPO
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Preserve/recover **vital records**; meet RTO/RPO by service tier. [12 CFR Part 749](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-749).
controls.system_behavior: ** Tiered backups (critical, high, standard); immutable/offsite copies; periodic restore tests.
controls.timers_slas: ** Critical RPO ≤15m; restore test each tier **quarterly**.
controls.edge_cases: ** Crypto-lock events → use clean point-in-time per RPO.
controls.access_control: ** Backup admins limited; dual-control for key ops.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Backup success rate; time-to-restore vs RTO.

controls.name: Alternate Site & Remote Operations
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Ensure operations can continue when facilities are unavailable. [12 CFR Part 749](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-749).
controls.system_behavior: ** Pre-approved remote posture (VPN, MFA, split DNS), hot/virtual site options, minimum staffing lists.
controls.timers_slas: ** Alt site/remote ready ≤8h; full critical ops ≤24h.
controls.edge_cases: ** Power/internet regional outage → cellular failover kits.
controls.access_control: ** IT approves access; HR verifies assignments.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % essential staff remote-ready; VPN capacity headroom.

controls.name: Major IT Failure Response
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Safeguards mandate timely containment and continuity; coordinate with service providers. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** Runbook for core/cloud outages: detect, isolate blast radius, rollback/failover, communicate.
controls.timers_slas: ** IC ≤5m; member status ≤15m; failover per BIA tier.
controls.edge_cases: ** Partial data divergence → choose authoritative ledger and reconcile.
controls.access_control: ** SRE change authority; dual-control for rollback.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** MTTR; % successful failovers; incident comms latency.

controls.name: Incident Response (Privacy/Security)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Implement GLBA-aligned incident response, including service provider coordination and member notification where appropriate. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** Contain, eradicate, recover; legal/regulatory consult; notification decisioning; forensics; evidence chain.
controls.timers_slas: ** Containment start ≤1h; counsel consult ≤24h; notices per law.
controls.edge_cases: ** Third-party breach without final RCA → send interim member comms.
controls.access_control: ** Need-to-know only; legal holds applied.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Time to containment; completeness of affected records.

controls.name: Communications & Notification Tree
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Board accountability for orderly operations and delegation includes communication plans. [12 CFR §701.4](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-701/section-701.4).
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain contact trees for employees, Board, regulators, vendors, media; predefined status page playbooks.
controls.timers_slas: ** First internal alert ≤15m; regulator per law/policy.
controls.edge_cases: ** Comms platform failure → backup channels (SMS/phone tree).
controls.access_control: ** Comms lead manages templates; IC approves releases.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Delivery success; time-to-first-message.

controls.name: People Continuity & Pandemic
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Preparedness for people outages supports continuity. [12 CFR Part 749](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-749).
controls.system_behavior: ** Identify essential roles; cross-train; implement split teams/remote work; track absenteeism.
controls.timers_slas: ** Activate plan within **24h** of trigger.
controls.edge_cases: ** Caregiver concentration risk → augment with contractors.
controls.access_control: ** HR controls PII; BCM receives aggregate stats only.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Essential coverage %; cross-train coverage %.
controls.purpose: Staffing plans; split teams; HR triggers.

controls.name: Post-Incident Review (PIR)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Board oversight expects effectiveness assessment and improvement loop. [12 CFR §701.4](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-701/section-701.4).
controls.system_behavior: ** Conduct PIR with root cause, what worked/failed, corrective action plan (CAP), retest.
controls.timers_slas: ** Draft PIR ≤10 business days; CAP approved ≤30 days; verify completion per due dates.
controls.edge_cases: ** Vendor RCA delayed → issue interim PIR; update upon receipt.
controls.access_control: ** PIR read-in limited; published summary for staff learning.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % PIR on time; CAP closure velocity.

controls.name: Vendor Contingency Management
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Safeguards require oversight of service providers’ incident response and continuity capabilities. [12 CFR Part 748 Appendix A](https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-12/part-748/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20748).
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain vendor BCP/IR attestations, SLAs, and failover plans; define exit/failover criteria.
controls.timers_slas: ** Annual evidence refresh; failover test per tier.
controls.edge_cases: ** Shared failure modes (e.g., same cloud region) → diversify.
controls.access_control: ** Vendor risk team manages repository.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % critical vendors with current DR evidence; SLA breaches to PIRs.

controls.name: Enterprise Risk Appetite Statement
controls.why_reg_cite: Align risk-taking with the Credit Union’s mission and strategic plan and set clear boundaries for risk, consistent with NCUA ERM expectations and safety-and-soundness standards (including [12 CFR Part 741](https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/12/part-741) and related guidance).
controls.system_behavior:
* Store a **single authoritative enterprise risk appetite statement** document and structured data (per risk category) in the risk system.
  * Enforce versioning, effective/expiry dates, and approval history (Board, committees).
  * Lock appetite settings from edit except by authorized roles (CRO + delegated risk officers) with electronic approvals.
controls.timers_slas:
* Enterprise risk appetite reviewed at least annually and within 90 days of a material strategic change.
  * System flags upcoming review **30 days** before `risk_appetite.next_review_date`.
controls.edge_cases:
* Overlapping or conflicting appetite statements (e.g., enterprise vs. specific program) must be flagged for CRO resolution.
  * If a new risk category is created without appetite defined, system must label it **“UNDEFINED APPETITE”** and prevent marking residual risk as “within appetite”.
controls.access_control:
* Read: all management, Internal Audit, and Board support staff.
  * Edit: CRO and designated ERM staff only.
  * Approve: Risk Committee / Board via recorded governance process (no direct in-system “approve” by staff without evidence of governance).
controls.alerts_metrics:
* Count of risk categories with **defined** vs. **undefined** appetite.
  * % of appetite statements reviewed on time.
  * Automatic alerts to CRO and Corporate Secretary when appetite review is overdue.
controls.purpose: Define how much risk the Credit Union is willing to accept by risk type and align ERM to strategy.

controls.name: Risk Taxonomy & Categories
controls.why_reg_cite: A clear, enterprise-wide risk taxonomy is a core component of ERM and risk culture; it enables consistent assessment across risk types as expected by NCUA ERM guidance.
controls.system_behavior:
* Maintain a canonical list of risk categories and subcategories (financial, operational, compliance, technology, model, strategic, reputational, etc.).
  * Enforce selection from this taxonomy for every risk entry in the risk register, KRI, and incident record.
controls.timers_slas: * Taxonomy reviewed at least annually and when adding new product types, business lines, or risk domains.
controls.edge_cases:
* Legacy records mapped to deprecated categories must retain historical mapping while being reclassified into current taxonomy.
  * System must prevent creation of a risk record with a free-text category not in taxonomy.
controls.access_control:
* Edit: ERM team under CRO.
  * Read: all systems and users that create or review risk-related records.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* % of risk records mapped to deprecated categories.
  * Count of categories/subcategories per risk type (to avoid unnecessary proliferation).
controls.purpose: Define consistent risk categories covering financial, operational, compliance, technology, model, strategic, and reputational risk.

controls.name: Risk Scoring Matrix & Rating Scale
controls.why_reg_cite: A consistent scoring methodology is required for meaningful, comparable risk assessment across risk types; aligns with NCUA expectations for effective risk management and internal control frameworks.
controls.system_behavior:
* Implement a **5x5 likelihood vs. impact matrix**, with numerical scores and qualitative labels for both axes and overall risk rating (e.g., Very Low, Low, Moderate, High, Very High).
  * Enforce use of this matrix for all enterprise risk assessments (financial, operational, etc.) unless explicitly exempted by CRO.
controls.timers_slas: * Risk scoring scale reviewed at least every three years or when major changes occur in business model or regulatory expectations.
controls.edge_cases:
* If likelihood/impact inputs are missing, system blocks saving the assessment.
  * If risk is purely qualitative (e.g., emerging risk), system requires default scoring rules approved by ERM.
controls.access_control:
* Scale configuration: ERM only.
  * Risk scoring inputs: risk owners and delegates for their risks; read for others as appropriate.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* Distribution of residual risk ratings across categories (heatmap).
  * Count and percentage of risks rated High/Very High inherent vs. residual.
controls.purpose: Define the 5x5 likelihood/impact matrix and scoring rules used across the Credit Union.

controls.name: Risk Assessment & Register Maintenance
controls.why_reg_cite: NCUA expects credit unions to identify, measure, monitor, and control risk; a central risk register and periodic assessments are foundational to this obligation.
controls.system_behavior:
* Maintain a **centralized enterprise risk register** that holds all material risks, their ratings, controls, and owners.
  * Support risk lifecycle states (identified, assessed, mitigated, monitored, closed).
  * Integrate with incident, model risk, vendor risk, and compliance issue tracking to avoid duplicate risk records.
controls.timers_slas:
* High/Very High residual risks: reassessed at least quarterly.
  * Moderate: at least annually.
  * Low/Very Low: every two years or on trigger events.
controls.edge_cases:
* Duplicate risk records must be merged with clear history.
  * Risks with no owner or no review within SLA are automatically flagged.
controls.access_control:
* Create/Update: first-line risk owners and designated delegates; ERM can edit meta fields and ensure consistency.
  * Read: at minimum, management, Internal Audit, and relevant committee support staff.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* ## and % of risks with overdue reassessments.
  * Top 10 residual risks by score and trend over time.
controls.purpose: Ensure all material risks are assessed, rated, owned, and kept current in a centralized register.

controls.name: Key Risk Indicators & Thresholds
controls.why_reg_cite: KRIs are a standard tool in ERM to monitor whether actual risk levels remain within appetite and to provide early warning of emerging issues.
controls.system_behavior:
* Allow definition of KRIs linked to specific risks and categories, with numeric thresholds aligned to appetite (green/amber/red).
  * Support automated and manual data feeds; compute status vs. thresholds and aggregate for dashboards.
controls.timers_slas: * KRIs refreshed at configured frequency; system flags stale data if no update received within 1.5x expected interval.
controls.edge_cases:
* KRIs with incomplete thresholds or missing direction must not be marked “Active”.
  * Manual overrides of KRI values must be documented and auditable.
controls.access_control:
* Configure thresholds: ERM + risk owners for their KRIs.
  * Read-only dashboards: managers, committees, Internal Audit, Board support.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* Count of red and amber KRIs by category.
  * % of KRIs with stale data.
  * Time from breach detection to initial triage.
controls.purpose: Set measurable indicators and thresholds that operationalize risk appetite and trigger escalation.

controls.name: Risk Appetite Breach Escalation & Incident Management
controls.why_reg_cite: Safety-and-soundness expectations require timely identification, escalation, and remediation of risk positions outside appetite; effective escalation pathways are essential to Board oversight and supervisory confidence.
controls.system_behavior:
* Detect when risk assessments, KRIs, or quantitative limits indicate a position is **outside** approved appetite.
  * Automatically generate a **breach record** with severity, initial triage, and escalation workflow.
  * Track remediation activities until risk is back within appetite or formally accepted (RA-07).
controls.timers_slas:
* Initial triage and notification to CRO within **1 business day** for Major/Critical breaches.
  * Presentation to appropriate committee (e.g., Risk Committee, ALCO) within **30 calendar days** for Major/Critical breaches.
  * Breach status reviewed at least monthly until closure.
controls.edge_cases:
* Multiple related breaches (e.g., repeated KRIs) may be linked to a single “master breach” to avoid noise while maintaining paper trail.
  * If a breach cannot be remediated within target date, RA-07 risk acceptance workflow must be triggered.
controls.access_control:
* Create: first-line risk owners, ERM, Internal Audit (for observed breaches).
  * Modify: ERM and accountable executive; closure requires ERM sign-off.
  * Read: relevant management and Board committees.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* ## of open breaches by severity and age.
  * Breaches per quarter by category.
  * Average time-to-triage and time-to-close.
controls.purpose: Define pathways and timelines for escalating, triaging, and resolving appetite breaches.

controls.name: Risk Acceptance & Exceptions
controls.why_reg_cite: Some risk positions may remain outside appetite for a period when remediation is not immediately feasible. Formal risk acceptance ensures transparency, documented rationale, and Board-aligned governance.
controls.system_behavior:
* Provide structured **risk acceptance** workflow tied to specific risks and breaches.
  * Record approver, rationale, conditions, and expiry date; track renewal and revocation.
controls.timers_slas:
* Risk acceptance requests decided within 30 calendar days of submission.
  * System issues alerts 30 and 7 days before acceptance expiry.
controls.edge_cases:
* No “indefinite” acceptances: system must require explicit end date; renewals create a new record referencing prior acceptance.
  * If acceptance expires without renewal, risk must revert to “breach” status until within appetite.
controls.access_control:
* Request: first-line risk owners and accountable executives.
  * Approve: only roles defined in delegation of authority (e.g., CRO for Moderate; Risk Committee/Board for High/Very High).
  * Read: ERM, Internal Audit, relevant committees.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* Count of active acceptances by severity and category.
  * % of acceptances renewed vs. remediated.
  * Acceptances that lapsed without timely review.
controls.purpose: Govern who may accept or temporarily tolerate risk positions above appetite and how.

controls.name: Risk Reporting & Governance Oversight
controls.why_reg_cite: Effective governance requires reliable, concise risk reporting to management and the Board, including aggregate views and trends, consistent with NCUA ERM guidance and Board responsibilities for safety and soundness.
controls.system_behavior:
* Generate standard risk reports and dashboards for management committees and the Board (e.g., heatmaps, top risks, breach summaries, KRI trends).
  * Support drill-down from aggregate views to underlying risk assessments, breaches, and acceptances.
controls.timers_slas:
* Management risk reports at least monthly.
  * Board / Board Risk Committee risk reports at least quarterly.
  * Ad-hoc reports within timelines set by Board or regulators.
controls.edge_cases:
* Conflicting numbers between systems (e.g., ALM vs. risk register) must be reconciled or explicitly explained in the report.
  * If data is incomplete, report must contain visible caveats rather than silently omitting segments.
controls.access_control:
* Generate & configure: ERM and CRO delegates.
  * Read: audiences as defined by report type; Board-facing packs controlled by Corporate Secretary.
controls.alerts_metrics:
* Report delivery timeliness against committee calendars.
  * Number of material issues requiring Board attention per period.
  * Completion of Board-directed follow-ups.
primary_rules: SR 11-7 concepts for model-based risk reporting
controls.purpose: Ensure timely, transparent risk reporting to management and the Board, and alignment with 3-lines-of-defense.

controls.name: Governance & Ownership
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Board-approved BSA/AML program; designated BSA Officer; internal controls, independent testing, training. **12 CFR §748.2**. FFIEC Manual informs examiner expectations for CDD governance and reporting.
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain policy artifact; require annual board approval; produce quarterly CDD metrics aligned to FFIEC themes (alerts, SARs, ECDD coverage, model/change controls); route escalations to Management Risk Committee and Board Risk Committee.
controls.timers_slas: ** Annual policy review; quarterly metrics due by **+15 days** after quarter-end.
controls.edge_cases: ** Interim updates for regulatory or FFIEC manual changes (out-of-cycle board ratification).
controls.access_control: ** Only BSA Officer may publish; Board/Examiners read.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Policy age; open issues past due; % actions closed on time.

controls.name: Scope & Applicability
controls.why_reg_cite: ** BSA program must cover all lines and delivery channels. **12 CFR §748.2**.
controls.system_behavior: ** Enforce CDD gates on all onboarding APIs (first-party and \{{Program\_Manager\_1\}}/\{{Program\_Manager\_2\}}) before account open; include non-face-to-face per FFIEC risk factors.
controls.timers_slas: ** 30-day pre-launch CDD sign-off window.
controls.edge_cases: ** Pilot/limited release still requires gates.
controls.access_control: ** Product owners propose; Compliance approves.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % launches with CDD sign-off.

controls.name: Member Risk Profiling (Nature & Purpose)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Understand nature/purpose; establish risk profiles; ongoing CDD. **31 CFR §1020.210**. FFIEC Manual outlines factors for risk rating and documentation quality.
controls.system_behavior: ** Capture expected activity; assign initial risk score; store rationale; support refresh.
controls.timers_slas: ** MRP must exist **before** decision.
controls.edge_cases: ** Thin-file; non-resident; PEP indicator.
controls.access_control: ** Read: Investigations/Compliance; Edit: Onboarding Ops/Compliance.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % files with complete MRP; risk score distribution.

controls.name: CIP & Identity Verification
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Identify & verify customers; recordkeeping. **31 CFR §1020.220**. FFIEC Manual provides examiner expectations for documentary vs non-documentary methods and risk-based variation.
controls.system_behavior: ** Orchestrate KYC via \{{Primary\_KYC\_Vendor\_Name\}} with fallback to \{{Secondary\_Data\_Providers\}}; apply documentary/non-documentary methods; block open until pass.
controls.timers_slas: ** Complete **before** account opening.
controls.edge_cases: ** Mismatches; fraud signals; manual review path with dual control.
controls.access_control: ** Only trained reviewers may override vendor outcomes.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** False-positive/negative rates; manual review rate; aging queue.

controls.name: Beneficial Ownership (Legal Entities)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Collect & verify BO (≥25% owners + one control). **31 CFR §1010.230**.
controls.system_behavior: ** Require BO form; validate IDs of BOs; store control person data; reconcile to KYB.
controls.timers_slas: ** Complete **before** business account opening; refresh on ownership change event.
controls.edge_cases: ** Trusts; layered entities; exemptions (document rationale).
controls.access_control: ** BO data restricted (need-to-know).
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % BO verified; exception count.

controls.name: Sanctions & Adverse Media Screening
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Risk-based screening is an AML control. **31 CFR §1020.210**. FFIEC Manual covers sanctions screening expectations and ongoing monitoring ties.
controls.system_behavior: ** Screen applicants and ongoing members via \{{Sanctions\_List\_Provider\}} and \{{Adverse\_Media\_Provider\}}; auto-hold on potential match; adjudication workflow.
controls.timers_slas: ** Potential match held immediately; adjudicate within **1 business day**.
controls.edge_cases: ** Common-name matches; transliteration; fuzzy logic collisions.
controls.access_control: ** Only Sanctions Analysts adjudicate.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Hit rate; average time to disposition; % confirmed.

controls.name: ECDD Triggers & Actions
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Higher-risk relationships require ECDD. **31 CFR §1020.210**. FFIEC outlines risk factors (products, services, geographies, customers) and documentation standards.
controls.system_behavior: ** On trigger, generate ECDD checklist; require senior approval; increase monitoring cadence.
controls.timers_slas: ** Open ECDD within **1 business day** of trigger; complete within **5 business days** or document extension.
controls.edge_cases: ** False positives from vendor models—require human rationale.
controls.access_control: ** Senior Compliance approves; dual control on exits.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** % ECDD timely; keep/exit ratios.

controls.name: Rejection & Exit Thresholds
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Maintain safe and sound operations. **12 CFR §748.2**. FFIEC provides examples of risk indicators supporting deny/exit decisions.
controls.system_behavior: ** Enforce configurable thresholds aligned to \{{Risk\_Appetite\_Summary\}}; block onboarding or trigger exit.
controls.timers_slas: ** Decision within **2 business days** of final facts.
controls.edge_cases: ** Critical customer impact—offer controlled wind-down.
controls.access_control: ** Two-person approval for exits (Compliance + Business).
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Decline rate by reason; exit count; appeals.

controls.name: Ongoing Monitoring & Reviews
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Ongoing monitoring & updates to risk profiles. **31 CFR §1020.210**. FFIEC Manual details alert handling, case documentation, SAR decisions, and periodic reviews.
controls.system_behavior: ** Compare observed activity to MRP; surface anomalies; schedule refresh per \{{Review\_Frequencies\}}; integrate case management and SAR workflow.
controls.timers_slas: ** Alert triage within **1 business day**; periodic refresh per risk tier (e.g., high 12m / med 24m / low 36m—confirm in \{{Review\_Frequencies\}}).
controls.edge_cases: ** Seasonality; one-off spikes; partner-driven campaigns.
controls.access_control: ** Investigations role required.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Alert-to-SAR conversion; refresh compliance %; case aging.

controls.name: Vendor & Program-Manager Oversight
controls.why_reg_cite: ** CU retains accountability for outsourced BSA functions. **12 CFR §748.2**. Interagency TPRM guidance defines life-cycle controls (plan, diligence, contract, monitor, terminate) and board oversight; apply to \{{Primary\_KYC\_Vendor\_Name\}}, \{{Secondary\_Data\_Providers\}}, \{{Program\_Manager\_1\}}, \{{Program\_Manager\_2\}}.
controls.system_behavior: ** Maintain live register; track SLAs/KPIs; enforce audit/exam rights; require incident-notice terms compatible with **§748.1(c)** 72-hour rule; document model governance for vendor decisioning (inputs, thresholds, backtesting/drift).
controls.timers_slas: ** KPI review quarterly; comprehensive review annually (min).
controls.edge_cases: ** Sub-processor changes; model drift at vendor—trigger re-validation; cross-border data transfers.
controls.access_control: ** Vendor Mgmt edits; Compliance/Board reads.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** SLA adherence %; issue backlog; model drift indicators.

controls.name: Incident & Breach Reporting (NCUA 72-Hour)
controls.why_reg_cite: ** Cyber incident notification to NCUA; member notice guidance. **12 CFR §748.1(c)**; **Appendix B to Part 748**.
controls.system_behavior: ** Classify incidents; start 72-hour clock on reasonable belief or third-party notice; prepare NCUA notice; assess member notification under Appendix B; coordinate with SAR decision path.
controls.timers_slas: ** Notify NCUA **≤72 hours**; PIR within **30 days** of containment.
controls.edge_cases: ** Overlapping jurisdictions; law-enforcement hold on member notices—document.
controls.access_control: ** CISO & Compliance control external comms.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Time-to-notify; incidents by severity; PIR action closure.
controls.purpose: Notify NCUA; member notice if required

controls.name: Recordkeeping & Retention
controls.why_reg_cite: ** CIP recordkeeping; BO retention; retrievability. **31 CFR §1020.220**; **§1010.230**. FFIEC Manual informs examiner expectations for documentation completeness and retrievability.
controls.system_behavior: ** Store KYC/BO evidence in immutable, searchable storage; index to member ID; support examiner export.
controls.timers_slas: ** Retain per rule (e.g., identity verification records generally **5 years after account closure**; confirm detailed schedules with Counsel).
controls.edge_cases: ** Data subject access requests; litigation holds override normal purge.
controls.access_control: ** Role-based; encryption at rest/in transit.
controls.alerts_metrics: ** Retrieval success rate; stale files without index.
